We would also need to verify the description and quantity of the cargo being destructed and this quantity/brand will need to be reflected in the destruction certificate. Please advise. 

 

We are available on any day next week during normal working hours. Please advise us at least one day in advance prior planning for the destruction.

Dear Zameer,

 

Noted your message. As per your policy clause quoted below, we would need to attend and witness during the destruction and also, we would need the destruction certificate with the quantity and details of the cargo destructed, once this is completed. 

Hence, kindly advise us when you plan to carry out the destruction, contact details of the person to liaise and the location, so that we can attend in time, to be present during this time. Please do not start the destruction prior to our attendance.

 

QUOTE  

Subject to prior agreement by underwriters the assured shall dispose of the damaged goods to the best advantage or they shall be destroyed in the presence of both a representative of underwriters and the assured…”.

UNQUOTE

 

Regards,

Dear Sirs,

 

Many thanks for your message content duly noted. 

 

We haven’t noted any clause in your policy implying that the alleged damaged cargo can be retained at only 25% salvage and claimed for the 75% loss. 

 

Hence, we kindly request you to reconsider your offer and revert back with a reasonable offer in your efforts to mitigate the loss by repacking and/or retaining the affected products at a better salvage value?  

 

Look forward to hearing from you.  

 

 

In closing and as a matter of routine protocol, please note that our enquiries into this matter continue on a without prejudice basis to the issue of policy liability. Nothing within this or future communication, or omitted from it, should be understood by you to confirm or imply any acceptance of policy liability on the part of the Insurer. Without Prejudice

 

Dear Sirs,

 

Many thanks for your message content duly noted. 

 

Ideally, we have to explore all means to mitigate the loss including getting multiple salvage quotes for the alleged damaged products and consider the best option, including retained salvage by the assured. Hence, we would like to check for the salvage value if possible or if you would be considering any option of repacking/relabelling of the products? 

 

In this case, you are offering 25% salvage value for the alleged damaged products, since you are expecting 75% of the claim value. We would expect a better salvage value for the alleged affected products, since the wet damages are mainly on the packing and external labels/packing. Hence, we look forward to your positive response regarding:

 

1.	Your agreement for considering salvage sale of the affected products?  
2.	Your efforts to mitigate the loss by repacking and/or retaining the affected products at a better salvage value?  

 

Look forward to hearing from you.  

 

 

In closing and as a matter of routine protocol, please note that our enquiries into this matter continue on a without prejudice basis to the issue of policy liability.

Without Prejudice

 

Dear Sirs,

 

Many thanks for your message content duly noted. 

 

We haven’t noted any clause in your policy implying that the alleged damaged cargo can be retained at only 25% salvage and claimed for the 75% loss. 

 

Hence, we kindly request you to reconsider your offer and revert back with a reasonable offer in your efforts to mitigate the loss by repacking and/or retaining the affected products at a better salvage value?  

 

Look forward to hearing from you.  

 

 

In closing and as a matter of routine protocol, please note that our enquiries into this matter continue on a without prejudice basis to the issue of policy liability. Nothing within this or future communication, or omitted from it, should be understood by you to confirm or imply any acceptance of policy liability on the part of the Insurer. Such enquiries are ongoing, and a decision with regards to policy liability (if any) shall be made by the Insurer once they are in receipt of all pertinent claim information and are in a position to do so. Insurers' assessment of policy liability (if any) is at all times subject to the Policy Terms and Conditions and all of Insurers' rights under the Policy are expressly reserved until otherwise communicated in writing by the Insurer or its authorized representative.

 

Regards,

OP

 

Capt Omprakash Marayil

Associate of Association of Average Adjusters

FICS, AFNI, MIIMS

 

Principal Surveyor

SOTERIA Surveyors & Loss Adjusters

Central Bank of The UAE 

Licensing Department Registration No.

Without Prejudice

 

Dear Sirs,

 

Many thanks for your message content duly noted. 

 

Ideally, we have to explore all means to mitigate the loss including getting multiple salvage quotes for the alleged damaged products and consider the best option, including retained salvage by the assured. Hence, we would like to check for the salvage value if possible or if you would be considering any option of repacking/relabelling of the products? 

 

In this case, you are offering 25% salvage value for the alleged damaged products, since you are expecting 75% of the claim value. We would expect a better salvage value for the alleged affected products, since the wet damages are mainly on the packing and external labels/packing. Hence, we look forward to your positive response regarding:

 

1.	Your agreement for considering salvage sale of the affected products?  
2.	Your efforts to mitigate the loss by repacking and/or retaining the affected products at a better salvage value?  

 

Look forward to hearing from you.  

 

 

In closing and as a matter of routine protocol, please note that our enquiries into this matter continue on a without prejudice basis to the issue of policy liability. Nothing within this or future communication, or omitted from it, should be understood by you to confirm or imply any acceptance of policy liability on the part of the Insurer. Such enquiries are ongoing, and a decision with regards to policy liability (if any) shall be made by the Insurer once they are in receipt of all pertinent claim information and are in a position to do so.

Dear Zameer,

From what we understand from the loss adjuster, your team is still in the process of moving out the sound packages. We were informed that advice was given to carry out segregation of the damaged products to mitigate the loss.

Once done, loss adjusters will get the full extent of the claim only after the segregation is completed. Kindly let us know if this has already been done.

On a different note, please ensure that the carriers and forwarders are notified about these damages to ensure that our recovery rights are not prejudiced.

Best Regards,
